struct expr * expr

Detailed Description

expr_stmt Parsed expressions statements become object instanstiations of this class

an example of an expression statement is the assignment statement below: a=5*10; This class contains and expr* pure virutal base class pointer as a member. The expr* expr generates its own code through the print_expr(ostringstream& code_bef_expr, ostringstream& code_expr) pure virtual function - which is over-ridden in each of the expression classes

Member Function Documentation

void expr_stmt::generate_code ( ostringstream &  quest_defns,
ostringstream &  program_code 
) [virtual]

generate_code(): Pure virtual functions takes 2 streams which as parameters code is written to both the streams the code in the quest_defns stream appears before the code in the program_code stream

Implements stmt.
